author: Special Correspondent
text:
A court here dismissed the bail petition of Tourism Minister S.P. Shunmuganathan’s personal assistant who was arrested for allegedly cheating and verbally abusing a Dalit.

M. Krishnamurthy alias Murthy (56), PA to Mr. Shunmuganathan, was arrested on March 16 on a charge of cheating. Murthy, a resident of Vijayanarayanam in the district, had allegedly demanded Rs. 3 lakh from P. Kirubanantha Murugan (38), AIADMK panchayat secretary, on the promise of getting his wife a permanent job as a Lab Assistant in a school. Murugan paid the money six months ago, but the promise was not kept, he claimed and demanded return of the money.

When Murthy refused and allegedly abused Murugan by referring to his caste, he lodged a complaint with the police who registered a case against Murthy under Sections 420, 294 (b), 506 (i) of the IPC and the provisions of the SC/ST Act and arrested him.

When the bail petition came up for hearing on Wednesday, Second Additional Sessions Court Judge Abdul Khader dismissed the plea.
title: Bail petition dismissed
